author: Olivia Gomm
description: U.S. President Donald Trump said he will “discuss trade” with Prime Minister Mark Carney and Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum, as the leaders were scheduled to meet later in the day at the FIFA World Cup draw event in Washington on Dec. 5. Carney arrived in Washington, D.C., on the morning of Dec. 5 to participate […]
title: Trump Says Trade Talks Part of Meeting With Carney, Mexican President During FIFA Draw

author: The Canadian Press
description: Hundreds of workers have been warned they may lose their jobs as the government moves to shrink the size of the public service. The Public Service Alliance of Canada said Friday that 219 of its members at Natural Resources Canada received notices this week saying their jobs might be cut. In addition to those, the […]
title: Hundreds of Federal Public Servants Warned This Week of Job Cuts

author: Noé Chartier
description: News Analysis The Liberal government appeared to have found a way early this week to pass its controversial hate crime bill by reportedly agreeing to Bloc Québécois amendments to remove the religious defence to hate speech, but backlash was quick and came from multiple sides. The government’s position now appears in limbo, with the cancellation […]
title: What’s the Controversy on the Hate Crime Bill and Amendments Impacting Religion?

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal government says it is proposing to reissue fishing licences to a coalition of Mi’kmaw First Nations in Atlantic Canada, despite objections from Inuit in Nunavut. In 2021, Inuit sued the federal government over its decision to hand over a sizable portion of fishing licences off Nunavut’s coast to the First Nations coalition, after […]
title: Ottawa Moving to Reissue Fishing Licences to Mi’kmaw Group Despite Inuit Objections

author: Chandra Philip
description: Quebec’s Liberal Party leader says he’s expelling MNA Sona Lakhoyan Olivier from caucus after becoming aware she is under investigation by the ethics commissioner. Liberal Leader Pablo Rodriguez made the announcement in a Dec. 4 post on social media, saying he had been informed of the investigation and decided to suspend her from the caucus […]
title: Quebec Liberal Leader Expels Another MNA Amid Turmoil

author: Chandra Philip
description: Edmonton city council has approved a 6.9 percent property tax hike starting in 2026, a move it says is needed to fund city services and construction projects. City council previously approved a 5.7 percent increase for municipal property taxes in April, saying at that time that property taxes would generate $2.2 billion to fund city […]
title: Edmonton City Council Approves 6.9% Property Tax Increase

author: John Hilton-O’Brien
description: Bill C-9 hands a small number of activists the power to silence political opponents at the time they are most vulnerable: school board election season.
title: Hate Crimes Bill Hands Activists a Weapon for Local Elections

author: PA Media
description: A teenager who got out of an ambulance on a motorway was then Tasered by police before being hit by a car and killed, the police watchdog said. Logan Smith, 18, from Weston-super-Mare, was being taken to hospital in an ambulance at 11pm on November 30 when the vehicle had to pull over on the […]
title: Teenager Who Got out of Ambulance Was Tasered Before Being Killed by Car

author: PA Media
description: The bustling market town of Skipton in North Yorkshire has been crowned the happiest place to live in 2025. With a well-preserved medieval castle overlooking its centre, Skipton is surrounded by scenic views and is a gateway to the Yorkshire Dales. Attractions within the town include a traditional high street marketplace, a shopping arcade, a […]
title: Friendly Yorkshire Market Town Crowned Britain’s Happiest Place to Live

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Canada’s federal tax agency says it is reinstating penalties for failure to report service fees on T4A forms for the current tax year and beyond, in a bid to crack down on driver misclassification and illegal drivers in the trucking industry. The Dec. 4 announcement from the Canada Revenue Agency (CRA) comes amid a wider […]
title: Ottawa Toughens Tax Penalties for Misclassified Truck Drivers to Boost Industry Safety

author: PA Media
description: Flights at Edinburgh Airport have resumed after an IT issue with its air traffic control provider. Travel was suspended for a time after the issue arose on Friday morning. The airport said teams had been working to resolve the issue “as soon as possible”. In a statement at around 10.45am, a spokesman for the airport […]
title: Flights Resume After IT Issue Hits Air Traffic Control at Edinburgh Airport

author: PA Media
description: Scotland’s energy industry is facing an “existential threat”, the First Minister has claimed as he called for UK Government support. John Swinney and Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer met ahead of a summit of the British-Irish Council in Wales. The meeting came after job losses announced last month at an ethylene plant in Mossmorran, Fife, […]
title: Scotland’s Energy Industry Facing ‘Existential Threat’, Swinney Warns PM

author: PA Media
description: Sir Keir Starmer has set out moral and economic arguments for lifting children out of poverty as the Government launched its strategy on the issue, largely driven by the £3 billion decision to scrap the two-child benefit cap. The plan – long-awaited by campaigners – comes with around 4.5 million children living in poverty in […]
title: Starmer Sets out Plans to Cut Child Poverty by 550,000

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canada’s draw for next summer’s World Cup started well but finished with a twist of the tail. The Canadian men, ranked 27th in the world, drew No. 17 Switzerland, the fifth-ranked team in Pot 2 and then No. 51 Qatar, the 10th-ranked side in Pot 3. But Pot 4 threw up a yet-to-be determined European […]
title: Canadian Men to Face Switzerland, Qatar and Possibly Italy at 2026 World Cup

author: The Canadian Press
description: A problem with the signalling system caused a service interruption this morning on Montreal’s light-rail network. The malfunction occurred on the new branch of the rail system that opened last month, connecting downtown Montreal with its northern exurb of Deux-Montagnes, Que. A spokesperson for the REM—Réseau express métropolitain—says the signalling system allows the automated trains […]
title: Malfunction on New Branch of Montreal Rail Network Caused by Signalling System

author: Victoria Friedman
description: 'By really shedding light on what companies are doing, we give them an incentive to do better,' the Future of Life Institute's president said.
title: Existential Safety Is AI Industry’s Core Weakness, Study Warns

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Senior officials say alternate legal tools can keep Trump’s trade agenda intact even if the Supreme Court limits the president’s emergency powers.
title: Trump Officials Signal Tariffs Here to Stay Regardless of Supreme Court Ruling

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The deal inked by Prime Minister Mark Carney and Alberta Premier Danielle Smith late last month that paves the way for a new West Coast pipeline is largely supported by Canadians, a newly released poll suggests. An Abacus Data survey conducted within 24 hours of the agreement being signed on Nov. 27 found that 55 […]
title: Most Canadians Support Alberta Pipeline in Carney-Smith Energy Deal: Poll

author: Guy Birchall
description: Moscow's GRU military intelligence agency was sanctioned for its role in the death of a woman who unwittingly exposed herself to the nerve agent.
title: UK Sanctions Russia After Inquiry Holds Putin Responsible for 2018 Novichock Poisonings

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The talks unfolded as Washington pushes for deescalation and the U.N. peacekeeping force in southern Lebanon prepares to end its mission.
title: Talks With Israel Focused on Halting Israeli Military Action in Lebanon: Lebanese President

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Public Safety Minister Gary Anandasangaree says the Liberal government is launching a review of Ottawa’s firearms classification regime, including consultations with indigenous communities on the SKS rifle, ahead of the federal gun buyback program’s launch across Canada. Gun control groups have lobbied for Ottawa to include the SKS semi-automatic rifle on its list of banned […]
title: Ottawa Launches Review of Firearms Classification Regime, Consultations on SKS Rifle

author: Catherine Yang
description: Decades of foreign investment only strengthened the Chinese Communist Party.
title: Trump’s National Security Strategy Offers US Tech, Military Advantage as Alternative to CCP

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Canada’s unemployment rate fell by 0.4 percentage points to 6.5 percent in November, with 54,000 jobs being created, according to Statistics Canada. The Labour Force Survey released on Dec. 5 marks the second month in a row unemployment has fallen, declining from 7.1 percent to 6.9 percent. September’s unemployment rate was a high not seen […]
title: Unemployment Drops to 6.5 Percent as Economy Adds 54,000 Jobs: StatCan

author: The Canadian Press
description: More than 10,000 removal warrants in the Canada Border Services Agency inventory have been active for more than a year even as the agency says removals from Canada are at an all-time high. CBSA statistics show there are 33,000 removal warrants currently on the CBSA list and agency vice-president Aaron McCrorie says more the 22,000 […]
title: 10,000 CBSA Removal Warrants Active for More Than One Year

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The agreement for HIV/AIDS funding is the first under Trump's new approach since the Department for International Aid was disbanded.
title: US to Give $1.6 Billion to Kenya as Part of ‘America First’ Global Health Strategy

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Ottawa is serving Stellantis with a notice of default on its federal contracts as the automaker proceeds with plans to relocate a portion of its production to the United States, despite receiving hundreds of millions of dollars in Canadian funding. Industry Minister Mélanie Joly told a parliamentary committee on Dec. 4 that the automaker’s production […]
title: Government to Serve Stellantis With Default Notice on Funding Contracts, Minister Joly Says

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Japanese citizens are also urged to 'refrain from speaking loudly enough for others to hear when outside, and avoid conspicuous behavior.'
title: Japanese Embassy in China Issues Safety Advisory Ahead of Nanjing Massacre Anniversary

author: C.P. Champion
description: Commentary Almost all the monarchs who have ruled over Canada since 1867 died while reigning and were succeeded by their heir apparent: “Le roi est mort. Vive le roi.” But it’s unusual for elected office-holders to die in office—only two prime ministers have done so, one very long-serving and one very short: Sir John A. […]
title: The Last Chapter of Canadian Prime Ministers, From Macdonald to Mulroney

author: The Canadian Press
description: Critics are questioning the solidity of Saab’s pitch to deliver 10,000 jobs in Canada if it decides to set up shop here to assemble Gripen fighter jets. The Swedish company has said little about how it came to that number, making it hard to evaluate the offer. Saab spokesperson Jenny Gerdes said the estimate reflects […]
title: Critics Question Saab’s Offer to Bring 10,000 Aerospace Jobs to Canada

author: The Canadian Press
description: A Canadian pipeline boss led a new report advising the Trump administration on how to more quickly build new oil and gas infrastructure in the United States amid a push north of the border to do the same. U.S. Energy Secretary Chris Wright requested the study on permitting from the National Petroleum Council, which includes […]
title: TC Energy Boss Advises US on Speeding Along Oil and Gas Infrastructure

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Taipei announced an additional $40 billion in defense funding to counter China’s accelerating preparations for a potential forced unification.
title: Taiwan, Japan Warn of Expanded Chinese Military Activity in East Asian Waters

author: Guy Birchall
description: The Russian president is making his first visit to India, which is one of Russia's biggest export markets, in four years.
title: Putin and Modi Talk Trade, Peace in New Delhi

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog welcomed the EBU's decision, while Dutch, Irish, Slovenian and Spanish broadcasters announced a boycott.
title: Eurovision Clears Israel for 2026 Contest as 4 Broadcasters Quit Over Gaza War

author: Michael Zhuang
description: LA-based diaspora group says the blaze that killed 159 people reflects deeper governance failures and a political climate that stifles open inquiry.
title: Hong Kong Diaspora Demands Answers After Deadly High-Rise Fire

author: Cindy Li, Daniel Y. Teng
description: '[He] hit me on the forehead, striking my left eyebrow, and the bridge of my nose,' said Kun Li.
title: Assault Leaves Falun Gong Practitioner Bloodied, Days After Bomb Threat

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The claim was rejected last year and any further claims blocked.
title: Native Title Claim Over 25,000 Square Kilometres Back On, After Rare Court Ban

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: A federal senator has questioned defence contracts with Pioneer Computers, alleging its CEO has ties to organisations linked to Beijing’s United Front.
title: Australian Military Tech Supplier Linked to CCP United Front, Inquiry Hears

author: The Associated Press
description: NEW DELHI—Russian President Vladimir Putin landed in India Thursday on a state visit aimed at bolstering bilateral and economic ties between the two countries. Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi received the Russian leader at an airport in New Delhi, giving a bear hug and a tight handshake with the gusto of an old friend. Modi […]
title: Putin in New Delhi on State Visit Aimed at Bolstering Russia-India Ties

author: Monica O’Shea
description: Real-world testing found several electric vehicles travelled 3 to 31 percent less than their advertised driving range.
title: Tests Show EVs Travelling Less Than Their Advertised Range

author: Lily Zhou
description: The EU plans to release $3.5 billion next year to fund projects that reduce dependency and use existing and new measures to boost the bloc’s economic security.
title: EU Unveils Plan to Reduce Dependency on China for Minerals

author: Chandra Philip
description: BC MLA and OneBC Leader Dallas Brodie says assault charges should be soon filed involving an altercation at the University of Victoria where she and others went to engage students in discussions about residential schools. Brodie told The Epoch Times that the altercation occurred when she, former professor Frances Widdowson, and others were on campus on […]
title: BC MLA Says Assault Charges Are Forthcoming After Altercation on University of Victoria Campus

author: Olivia Gomm
description: A Chinese dissident who died in a kayaking accident in British Columbia was allegedly being targeted by Chinese secret police agents at the time of his death, according to evidence from a former Chinese spy. The former spy, known by the pseudonym “Eric,” who defected to Australia in 2023 and spoke with Australia’s ABC News […]
title: New Evidence Suggests Chinese Dissident Allegedly Targeted by Chinese Secret Police at Time of ‘Mysterious’ Kayak Death: Report

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The commission that organizes the official leaders’ debates for elections no longer wants to arrange the post-debate press conferences, following an incident during the last election that resulted in the English debate leadership scrums being cancelled. Leaders’ Debates Commission executive director Michel Cormier told the Procedure and House Affairs Committee on Dec. 4 that the […]
title: Commission Organizing Leaders’ Debates No Longer Wants Responsibility for Leaders’ Scrums

author: Daniel Y. Teng, Rex Widerstrom
description: Medical technology CEO Nick Coyle says Chinese businesses largely dominate sectors like mining and infrastructure.
title: Beijing Winning the PR War With Megaprojects in Pacific Nation, Australian CEO Warns

author: Jacob Burg
description: The boat was 'transiting along a known narco-trafficking route in the Eastern Pacific,' according to U.S. Southern Command.
title: Pentagon Says 4 Killed in New Drug Boat Strike

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: As the recently signed energy deal between Alberta and Ottawa paves the way for a potential oil pipeline to the West Coast, and amid talk of reviving the Keystone XL pipeline, the prospect of a West-to-East pipeline has taken a back seat in public discourse. Some still remain hopeful, however, that the cancellation of TC […]
title: Is a West-East Oil Pipeline Now a Bygone Idea?

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The government says it's 'full steam ahead' on initiatives including nuclear subs.
title: Australia ‘Working Through’ Finalised Pentagon Review of AUKUS
